" OwnerUserId="4645062" LastEditorUserId="774575" LastEditDate="2015-03-07T21:51:31.387" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T21:51:31.387" Title="Only last fprintf() output is written to the file" Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="9"/>

xamarin version is 5.7.1(build 17).
xamarin forms's version is 1.3.5.6337.
xamarin forms labs's version is 1.0.1.5.

Please help me if you have the experience with this error.

" OwnerUserId="4639946" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T19:56:55.140" Title="Can not compile after migrating unified api in xamarin forms" Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="0"/>

///****Latest attempt

$fields = array(
    'projectTitle' => 'b.BidTitle',
    'BidType' => 'b.BidType'
);

$where = array();
foreach($fields as $fieldPost => $fieldDb) {
    if(isset($_POST[$fieldPost]) && strlen($_POST[$fieldPost]) > 0) {
        $where[] = "`$fieldDb` = '$_POST[$fieldPost]'";
    }
}

   $sql = "Select b.ID,convert(char(10),b.BidDate,101) BidDate,convert(char(10),
          b.DueDate,101)DueDate,b.BidTitle,b.DueTime,b.BidID,BidIDFile,
          d.Department,b.BidType,CASE WHEN b.AwardDate ='01/01/1900' Then NULL ELSe convert(char(10),b.AwardDate,101)END AS AwardDate,
          convert(char(10),b.LastUpdate,101) LastUpdate,s.Status
          FROM bids b inner join dept d on b.Department=d.DeptID inner join Status s on b.BidStatus=s.StatusId
          " . ( count($where) > 0 ? " WHERE " . implode(' AND ', $where) : "" );
" OwnerUserId="967857" LastEditorUserId="967857" LastEditDate="2015-03-07T23:17:42.280" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T23:17:42.280" Title="How do I add dynamic WHERE clause for search filtering?" Tags="" AnswerCount="2" CommentCount="2"/>

" OwnerUserId="968292" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T20:20:27.090" Title="IDataRecord accessing LightSwitch" Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="0"/> " OwnerUserId="1983495" LastEditorUserId="1983495" LastEditDate="2015-03-08T01:07:29.290" LastActivityDate="2015-03-08T01:07:29.290" CommentCount="7"/>

If the user has selected for example only a title, then simply initialize $strbidType to ''.

" OwnerUserId="2149718" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T20:32:14.673" CommentCount="0"/>

That way, it'll look as if leads was a collection of its own, but it's not and this is just a bad hack around it.

Note that there's no wildcard operator, so if you want to have all fields projected to the root level, you'll have to do it manually. It'd be much easier to simply read the regular documents - if that's not what you need, correct your schema design.

" OwnerUserId="257786" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T20:40:31.557" CommentCount="2"/> " OwnerUserId="4158399" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T20:47:50.640" Title="Text Editor Dialog" Tags="" AnswerCount="1" CommentCount="1"/> " OwnerUserId="776930" LastEditorUserId="3100115" LastEditDate="2015-03-07T21:00:50.673" LastActivityDate="2015-03-07T21:00:50.673" Title="Grouping in MongoDB" Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="0"/>

Code (Got it from here somewhere) Edited to my use but, it didn't worked.

for /f "delims=" %%a in ('dir "%~dp0hidden-files\*.txt"') do (set "newname=%~nx1"
set "newname=%newname:!=-%"
set "newname=%newname:_=-%" 
set "newname=%newname:==-%"
set "newname=%newname:%=-%"
echo ren "%%a" "!newname!")

Would appreciate any help. Cheers.
